main event: A farmer reported observing three objects in a 'V' formation flying in an easterly direction toward Boston, Massachusetts, on April 6, 1949.
interesting points: The objects were described as being shiny, silver in color, with a size similar to a full moon, approximately twenty inches in diameter, and not perfectly flat.
The objects were observed at a 45-degree angle and appeared to be at the height of a thirty-five-story building at a distance of five to eight miles.
The objects seemed to disappear into a cloud or with a cloud and were described as approximately one-hundred-fifty feet apart.
Attempts to contact other witnesses in the vicinity proved to be futile, and no information concerning the alleged incident was found in the F.B.I., Albany Police Department, or State Police files.
The weather conditions at the time of the observation were reported to be clear with scattered dark wind clouds in the vicinity of the objects.
sighted object: shiny, silver objects resembling a full moon in size, approximately twenty inches in diameter
witnesses: Mr. [Redacted], a produce farmer and school bus driver
photographs: no photographs were included in the document
